alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 7:48PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in southern New Jersey...Burlington and Camden. In southeast Pennsylvania... Montgomery and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Local law enforcement reported a lane restriction on 130 in Camden due to flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Willingboro, Lumberton, Riverside, Palmyra, Beverly, Rockledge, Holmesburg, Tacony, Wissinoming, and Northeast Philadelphia. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 5. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 21 and 33. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 338 and 341. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 39 and 48. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 3 and 4. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
